column4: is there an iso for network install? i don't want to download 700+MB
do it anyways. and burn more copies for neighbors.
And that's why Linux market share is still low.
yeah if people like you keep talking it'll always be that way
I need to get something done right now and you're telling me to convince my neighbor to change OS? does that make sense to anybody here?
Besides, you should do dist-upgrade if you don't want to download the cd
who said that I already have ubuntu installed?
then you have to download iso
there you go, big time downside of ubuntu. forces you to install a huge iso. i know the mailing cds is great but not if you need to get work done now
It's not any different then Windows.
who said I am using windows? you're drawing conclusions very fast here. but thanks, I got the info I needed
i am using archlinux on my desktop and wanted ubuntu for my laptop
I am just saying even windows needs a cd to install an OS.
